meanings.definition: A person who has defeated or surpassed all rivals in a competition
meanings.sent1: The champions of the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The soccer champions lifted the trophy in victory.
meanings.sent3: The champions of the spelling bee celebrated with a big party.
meanings.sent4: She was a true champion in the art of negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The champions' determination inspired everyone around them.

meanings.definition: A person who fights or argues for a cause or on behalf of someone else
meanings.sent1: The champions of justice fought tirelessly for the rights of all.
meanings.sent2: The environmental champions protested to protect the forests.
meanings.sent3: The champions of the debate team always had strong arguments.
meanings.sent4: She was a champion for the voiceless, speaking up for those in need.
meanings.sent5: The champions of equality stood up against discrimination.

meanings.definition: To support, promote, or defend a cause or person
meanings.sent1: We champions the importance of education in our community.
meanings.sent2: She champions for the rights of animals in need.
meanings.sent3: He champions for his favorite charity by organizing fundraisers.
meanings.sent4: The group champions the need for clean water in developing countries.
meanings.sent5: The teacher champions her students' creativity and growth.
